noun.description: The action or state of forcing or being forced to do something; constraint.
examples: the payment was made under compulsion

noun.description: An irresistible urge to behave in a certain way, especially against one's conscious wishes.
examples: he felt a compulsion to babble on about what had happened

origin: Late Middle English: via Old French from late Latin compulsio(n-), from compellere to drive, force (see compel).
